body.p: As a result of these considerations, in August 2011 the IASB published the Exposure Draft Mandatory Effective Date of IFRS 9 (the ‘2011 Mandatory Effective Date Exposure Draft’). In the 2011 Mandatory Effective Date Exposure Draft, the IASB proposed that the mandatory effective date of IFRS 9 should be deferred to annual periods beginning on or after 1 January 2015. The IASB noted that it did not want to discourage entities from applying IFRS 9 and stressed that early application would still be permitted.
